verses.verse: I stood on the sand of the sea and saw a savage beast rise up out of the sea having seven heads and ten horns, and on his horns [were] ten crowns and on his heads the name of blasphemy.
This savage beast that I saw was like a leopard, his feet were like a bear's, and his mouth like a lion's, and the dragon gave him his power, his throne, and great authority.
Then I saw one of his heads looking like it had been violently slaughtered to death, and his deadly wound was healed. All the world was amazed and followed this beast,
and they worshipped the dragon who gave authority to the beast. They worshipped the beast saying, "Who [is] comparable to the beast? Who is able to make war with him?"
There was given to him a mouth speaking great things and blasphemies; authority was given to him to continue forty-two months.
He opened his mouth in blasphemy against God to blaspheme his name, his tabernacle, and those who live in heaven.
It was allowed for him to make war with the saints and to overcome them. Power was given to him over all tribes, languages, and nations.
All who live on the earth will worship him, those whose names are not written in the book of life of the Lamb slain from the foundation of the world.
If anyone has an ear, let him hear.
He who leads to captivity will go to captivity; he who kills with the sword must be killed with the sword. Here is the patience and the faith of the saints.
Then I saw another savage beast ascending out of the earth; he had two horns like a lamb's, but he spoke like a dragon.
He exercises all the authority of the first savage beast before him and causes all the earth and those who live in it to worship the first savage beast whose fatal wound was healed.
He does great miracles, so that he even makes fire to come down from heaven to the earth in the presence of people.

He deceives those who live on the earth by those miracles which he had power to do in the presence of the beast telling those who live on the earth that they must make a statue of the beast who had the wound by a sword and lived.
He was allowed to give life to the statue of the beast, so that the statue should both speak and cause all who would not worship the statue of the beast to be killed.
He also makes all whether small or great, rich or poor, free or slave to receive a mark on their right hand or on the forehead,
so that no one could buy or sell unless he had the mark, name of the beast, or number of his name.
Wisdom is needed here. Let him who has understanding compute the number of the beast, for it is the number of a man, and his number is six hundred sixty six.
